item.title: Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 7 2025
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Don’t miss a snap! Find the full Week 7 schedule for watching college football today on TV. We cover channel lineups and which games are must-watch matchups.

The post Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 7 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Nothing’s guaranteed these days, folks.

You can plan things out to a T, drop the checkbook, and make backup plans for your backup plans. But when push comes to shove, there’s no way to ensure you aren’t sending out the apology letters or eyeing the escape hatch after your team comes up short. (This goes ninefold if you’ve overseen the worst regular-season loss in college football history since the Reagan administration.)

What can you do if your team’s already looking into the playoff void at this season’s midpoint? Take that vacation! Go for it on fourth down! Check out the 10:00 a.m. Ludacris concert instead of studying for your midterms! If last weekend’s games taught us anything, there’s nothing wrong with being here for a good time.

For the Week 7 edition of the CableTV.com College Football What to Watch Guide, we’ll warm up the deep fryer, repeat ourselves yet again, and take the over.

Jump to:

  • CableTV.com’s Game of the Week
  • Week 7’s best college football games
  • College football Week 7 TV schedule

Interested in college football games today?

Subscribe to our email newsletter for the latest football takes, TV subscription deals, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

CableTV.com’s Game of the Week

Watch Indiana vs. Oregon | CBS

If you’re looking for a new Vibes Playoff Team after last weekend’s Penn State and Texas flameouts, may we suggest Top-10 Indiana?

For starters, Curt Cignetti continues to be one of the Big Ten’s top coaches in terms of Being A Hater and intensity. Plus, this year’s 5–0 Hoosiers squad is even better than last year’s squad in a few respects: Fernando Mendoza is one of the nation’s best quarterbacks, and they’re up to third nationally in ESPN’s SP+ thanks to blowout wins over Kennesaw State, Indiana State, and Illinois.

This week’s Oregon game gives the Hoosiers another chance to shake one of Cignetti’s few bugaboos: their record against elite competition. Dante Moore’s been an excellent first-year triggerman for the Oregon offense, and the Ducks held off Penn State in double overtime during Week 5’s 30–24 win. By comparison, the Hoosiers have yet to shake the specter of 2024 Indiana’s “good try, good effort” losses to Ohio State and Notre Dame.

At the moment, Oregon, Indiana, and Ohio State sit atop the Big Ten standings, and the winner of Saturday’s game will likely face Ohio State in Indianapolis. Despite Oregon’s name-brand recognition, they’re only favored by a touchdown over the Hoosiers, and it’s a virtual toss-up by the advanced stats.

How to stream #7 Indiana at #3 Oregon

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: CBS
Location: Autzen Stadium in Eugene, Ore.
Point spread: Oregon by 7.5

Stream on DIRECTV

CableTV.com’s Homefield Apparel of the week

Based in Indianapolis, Homefield offers officially licensed college apparel with exclusive vintage designs that draw from the history of more than 150 colleges. This week’s Homefield picks highlight vault pulls, bomber jackets, and more from Homefield’s Indiana and Oregon collections.

Want to upgrade your gameday fit? Click the link below to check out Homefield’s collections, and use promo code CABLETV to save 15% off your first order.

Buy Homefield College Football Shirts

Week 7’s best college football games to watch: weeknights

Watch Missouri State vs. Middle Tennessee | ESPN2

The Bears are working through their share of growing pains in their first FBS season in Conference USA. After opening the season with a 60-point loss to USC, they snagged a solid win over Marshall alongside a competitive loss to Western Kentucky. This week, they’ll try to rack up another win against a moribund Middle Tennessee squad.

How to stream Missouri State vs. Middle Tennessee

vs.

Date: Wednesday, Oct. 8
Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: Johnny Floyd Stadium in Murfreesboro, Tenn.
Point spread: Missouri State by 2.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch South Florida vs. North Texas | ESPN2

Last one surviving in the American Conference gets the playoff bid? The Bulls and Mean Green are right behind Navy and Memphis in the American standings and just ahead of Tulane—all five squads are right in the thick of the conference race.

North Texas has one of the nation’s most prolific offenses, while USF’s win over Florida looks even better after last weekend. (Does this give the Bulls a transitive win over Texas and mean Byrum Brown is a better quarterback than Arch Manning? Sure!)

How to stream South Florida at North Texas

vs.

Date: Friday, Oct. 10
Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: DATCU Stadium in Denton, Texas
Point spread: North Texas by 1.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Week 7’s best games: Saturday morning

Watch Ohio State vs. Illinois | FOX

The Illinois Playoff Dark Horse campaign took on a lot of water after they got disemboweled by Indiana. Although the Illini rebounded with wins over USC and Purdue, their season’s ceiling hinges on this week’s game against Ohio State. (No pressure!)

The Buckeyes have yet to break a sweat in Big Ten conference play, as they took care of business against Washington and paved over Minnesota last weekend. Julian Sayin also has the Ohio State offense running at peak efficiency, as his 65% passing success rate ranks first nationally.

How to stream #1 Ohio State at Illinois

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 12:00 p.m. ET
Channel: FOX
Location: Memorial Stadium in Champaign, Ill.
Point spread: Ohio State by 14.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch Pitt vs. Florida State | ESPN

After slogging through losses to West Virginia and Louisville, Pitt swapped out incumbent quarterback Eli Holstein for freshman Mason Heintschel. Against Boston College, Heintschel went off for four touchdowns and 323 yards in a 48–7 win. This week, Pitt will face off against a reeling Florida State team that just dropped games to Virginia and Miami.

How to stream Pitt at #25 Florida State

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 12:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN
Location: Doak Campbell Stadium in Tallahassee, Fla.
Point spread: Florida State by 9.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Week 7’s best games: Saturday afternoon

Watch Oklahoma vs. Texas | ABC

Haters of the Manning Industrial Complex, take note: this year’s edition of the Red River Rivalry may be the last occasion to dedicate serious airtime to Texas and Arch Manning this year. After its uninspiring Ohio State and Florida losses, Texas is all but out of the playoff race.

Oklahoma likely won’t have John Mateer (who’s still recovering from hand surgery) under center, but backup Michael Hawkins Jr. had no problem with Kent State last week. Plus, the Sooners also got long-awaited reps in for transfer running back Jaydn Ott—he ran for 49 yards on 11 carries.

How to stream #6 Oklahoma at Texas

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ABC
Location: Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Texas
Point spread: Texas by 2.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch Air Force vs. UNLV | CBS Sports Network

Air Force was on the opposite end of last weekend’s most entertaining game, as the Falcons went for 460 total yards in a 34–31 loss to Navy. They’ll try to make up for it this week against a 5–0 UNLV team that’s holding down the fort for the Mountain West’s playoff reputation.

THIS GAME.
Air Force ties it again! pic.twitter.com/N3Y64oM8FW

— CBS Sports College Football 🏈 (@CBSSportsCFB) October 4, 2025

How to stream Air Force at UNLV

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: CBS Sports Network
Location: Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas, Nev.
Point spread: UNLV by 7.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Week 7’s best games: Saturday evening

Watch Kansas vs. Texas Tech | FOX

Texas Tech is already a frontrunner in the Big 12 race, but thanks to Cincinnati’s upset win over Iowa State, they’re now sitting atop the conference standings. This week, they’ll face off against a tricky Kansas team that embodies Big 12 Chaotic Energy in more than a few ways—they’re ranked 44th nationally in points scored and points allowed.

How to stream Kansas at #9 Texas Tech

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
Channel: FOX
Location: Jones AT&T Stadium in Lubbock, Texas
Point spread: Texas Tech by 14.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch Michigan vs. USC | NBC

Speaking of hyped first-year quarterbacks, Michigan’s been the definition of a transitional team during Bryce Underwood’s first year under center. The 4–1 Wolverines have leaned on a streaky running game to make up for a fine-enough defense and a receiving room that’s led by converted quarterback Donaven McCulley.

As for USC, the 4–1 Trojans are once again a typical “elite offense, defense is also here” Lincoln Riley outfit. They narrowly dropped last week’s Illinois game in a 34–32 loss and will face off against Notre Dame next week in a three-game gauntlet against ranked teams.

How to stream #15 Michigan at USC

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
Channel: NBC
Location: Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum in Los Angeles, Calif.
Point spread: USC by 1.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch Florida vs. Texas A&M | ESPN

A few things are certainties in life: death, taxes, and Billy Napier pulling off mid-season wins that’ll make everyone involved furious. Florida’s big win over Texas was fueled by wide receiver Dallas Wilson giving the Gators offense another gear—Wilson went for 111 yards and two touchdowns on six receptions.

By comparison, the Aggies have been more methodical en route to their 5–0 start. They’ve taken down Notre Dame, Auburn, and Mississippi State with an offense and defense that rank 17th in SP+.

How to stream Florida at #5 Texas A&M

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 7:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN
Location: Kyle Field in College Station, Texas
Point spread: Texas A&M by 8.5

Stream on DIRECTV
